page.title: 03POPULATION
page.content: The population of Southborough in 1981 was 10069, an increase of 314 on 1971. Of the 1981 population, 3082 lived in the west ward, a density of 49.71 per hectare; 3044 lived in the east ward where the density is 18.23 per hectare. The north ward has a density of 8.23 per hectare. Of the total population 53% were female. 22% were aged 0-15, reflecting falling school rolls. All these figures came from the 1981 census abstracts. The data helped us to identify some of the major features of the area. There is only a small immigrant population of 4%. By checking with estate agents, we found that house prices were rising steadily. About 8% of the population moves each year. It was noted that only 5% of the population were unemployed and about 3.5% were students over sixteen.
